title: 项目方，我预判了你的预判——从5个空投案例分析怎么走在空投标准的前面
body:
*前言：回顾历史我们会发现，从Uniswap到Optimism，空投的标准变得越来越严苛，项目方正在尽一切努力把他们的代币发放到目标人群手上。要想获得足够多的空投，努力刷交互虽然很最重要，但如何走在项目方的空投标准前面才是我们必须要做的功课。*

*如果说猛刷交互是撸毛的1.0版本，那么精确撸到项目方的G点上，应该是撸毛的2.0版本。本文总结了过去值得参考的5个空投标准，并提炼出其中的精华，希望能给大家带来一些启迪，争取预判项目方的预判。*

*正文开始前再要说一句，当我朝着空投的未来趋势和方向做研究的时候，发现未来不过是历史的重复。这一篇攻略中的许多内容都受到了[@Mike8848](https://twitter.com/Mikemoo75197959)、[@丰密](https://twitter.com/duokongcrypto)、[@gm365.eth](https://twitter.com/gm365)、饼干等前辈过去文章的启迪，许多方法和观点已经被各路大神总结的差不多了，我所能做的，就是站在巨人的肩膀上，做一个缝合怪。*

## 正文

Uniswap应该是第一次大家领略到空投魅力的大规模空投，当时的空投也比较简单，所有参与过交互的人都可以领取400uni的空投，随着时间推移，项目方空投代币的规则也越来越复杂。

**正所谓“道高一尺魔高一丈”，今天我们从过去看向未来，大胆地预判一下未来项目方还会玩出什么新花样。**

**温馨提示：本文很长信息量很大，如没耐心可以直接看实战案例部分，也可以收藏下来慢慢看。**

## 1. DYDX/DeversiFi

### 1.1 空投回顾

![DYDX空投分配方案](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/R0-gXzNSw5Q6HY_MRCra0.png?height=516&width=1080)

大约是从DYDX开始，空投的规则变得复杂起来。项目方为不同资金量的用户设置了不同的等级（门槛）。

![DeversiFi空投分配方案](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VqqNTmSp2Zyixq7NGCW9Q.png?height=291&width=772)

DeversiFi成功吸取了在DYDX的经验，在设置**资金门槛**的基础上，还增加了**活跃度的门槛**，这一规则一直被沿用至现在，包括OP、Across（已提案）在内的各项目方的空投方案都在参考这样的方法。

### 1.2 启示

面对DEFI或跨链桥等需要一定资金的项目时，我们可以通过Dune、Footprint来跟踪项目的交易量，想办法让每个钱包的交易额/跨链量超过一定比例的用户，达到某一个门槛。同时也不要忘记至少每周使用一次要空投的项目，并在各个链上留有一定的资金（大约5-10刀）

### 1.3 实战案例：找到门槛

使用dune查看nomad跨链桥的状态：

[https://dune.com/0xroll/Nomad-Bridge-Ethereum](https://dune.com/0xroll/Nomad-Bridge-Ethereum)

这里我们可以直接引用用户0xroll已经做好的nomad链上分析，这里我们只需要点击\[Nomad Recent Transactions\]这一栏，然后把出来的代码分叉到自己的dune里面，修改一下要查找的交易记录，比如改为1000笔，就能轻松找出大多数人跨链时用了多少资金了。

关于Dune的具体使用方法，可以看看成员[@gm365.eth](https://twitter.com/gm365)的教程，我这里只是一个取巧的办法。

[https://mirror.xyz/gm365.eth](https://mirror.xyz/gm365.eth)

以上只是从资金方面做了分析，活跃度上，我们还需要保持每周一次以上的交互。

## 2. Paraswap/HOP

### 2.1 空投回顾

项目方需要羊毛党的交互的数据，羊毛党需要项目方的空投，两者真正的相爱相杀可能要从Paraswap开始算起，在HOP发币时达到一个巅峰。

![PSP非常严格的空投标准](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iXJq-y1ilSQD4QadU8uXq.png?height=330&width=827)

PSP发币前一直在利用空投PUA用户，拿到融资后立刻执行了更加严格的空投方案——通过修改空投方案，光明正大地把许多用户归为空投猎人，一个币也不给。这让许多普通用户也被反撸，导致了大量的不满，其代币也在空投后在不断地贬值，这个故事在HOP上延续着。

![HOP空头标准，资金量和LP是重点](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6ZCDWu6ccvBNFg22M6Qp9.png?height=425&width=737)

虽然后来的OP也同样不欢迎女巫，但是HOP让用户相互举报女巫的行为可谓是所有空投标准中的“集大成”者，这一次许多撸毛党都栽在了这里。

![区块律动上的一篇案例分析](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tWjxMuHm5-rloKFdgt2wF.png?height=585&width=830)

### 2.2 启示

**2.2.1 避免资金归集**。

目前来看，使用交易所归集、分发是最稳妥、省钱的方法，需要注意的是，存款的时候应该存入子账号，避免全部转入相同地址后被认定为女巫。

**2.2.2 混肴操作**。

根据早先一些被举报案例的报道，项目方主要通过资金归集、操作相似、时间相同、社交网络泄露地址并被举报等方式来鉴定女巫。

所以我们的在交互的时候至少应该避免以上的操作方式，同时还应该具备一定的前瞻性，把IP、浏览器痕迹（cookie）都考虑进来。

### 2.3 实战案例

**2.3.1 账号隔离**

这里介绍一下我自己防女巫的操作方法：

![我的操作方式](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/k-q44WjgI6YJJQvHOrZ9S.png?height=780&width=691)

a.使用多台电脑，每台电脑使用不同的VPN，保证IP不重复，平常使用chrome浏览器，且不接受任何cookie，用不同的谷歌账号开子浏览器管理钱包

b.每个谷歌账号中只有一套助记词（方便管理），助记词下配一个精撸账号（即有ENS、有大量交易纪录等）和5个以内的子钱包（可以互相转账，方便操作），组成一个钱包集

c.钱包集之间互相不能转账，严格隔离

d.一般情况下不使用批量刷的软件，一是保证钱包安全，二是避免被女巫

e.不明来源文件使用虚拟机打开，浏览器精简不必要的插件，不要心怀侥幸。

**2.3.2 交易所相关操作**

**a.归集资金**

中心化交易所仍然是最方便的跨链/隐私协议，资金归集的时候可以使用OKX、币安、FTX这些交易所。但是你的交易所钱包是固定的，**所以归集资金时应该创建子账号，不同钱包集的资金打入不同的账号**。

**b.分发资金**

我最近开始使用Layerswap来分撒资金，这是一个为交易所提供跨链功能的DAPP归集

![交易所跨链项目Layeswap](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/chJtAc_guTCASOQeh0akU.png?height=691&width=769)

使用这个DAPP，你需要获得交易所的API，注册Bransfer和Layerswap账户，步骤挺繁琐，但是不排除空投的可能，所以既然要转账，不如试试看。

篇幅有限，具体方法就不介绍了，这里找到一个参考的教程，时间有点早了，不保障完全可用。作者好像是[@baikaishui](https://twitter.com/0xbaikaishui)，未仔细核实。

[https://mirror.xyz/xunfa.eth/7eyIdL99aPVp-esIN0iH_YXApRkXjxIpoQt2sBcfvSM](https://mirror.xyz/xunfa.eth/7eyIdL99aPVp-esIN0iH_YXApRkXjxIpoQt2sBcfvSM)

当然，你也可以使用zkMoney归集资金，这也是一个必刷的协议，这类金融类产品最好增加交互的金额，提高你的空投权重（如果有的话）。

[https://zk.money/](https://zk.money/)

**2.3.3 操作随机**

我们的交互至少应该做到部分随机，以我自己为例，相同的交互操作每天只能在两个钱包集以内的账号上完成，且做到以下几点：

a.避免交互后立即反向操作，如跨链后立即跨回，交易usdt后立即买回原来的币

b.时间随机，一个钱包集交互后暂停一天以上的时间再做其他操作，如跨链后间隔三天再回到其他链

c.每个账户使用的金额完全随机，如有的钱包使用1eth交互，有的钱包使用0.2eth交互

## 3. Optimism

### 3.1 空投回顾

![原文链接：https://community.optimism.io/docs/governance/airdrop-1/#active-ethereum-participants](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vCfG2BkIu2Aznl-bde_vx.png?height=394&width=812)

有PSP和HOP的前车之鉴，Optimism的空投方案可谓是集大成者，既照顾了普通用户，也没有对羊毛党赶尽杀绝，很好的达到了项目方推广自己代币的同时又回馈忠实用户的目的\~\~，可惜被WinterMute玩崩了\~\~。

可以看到，OP作为一个由**DAO**构成的L2**公链**，十分注重链上公益行为。

这里我们把空投方案的细则一条条拉出来详细讲解。

### 3.2 启示

**3.2.1 链上投票**

这个没什么好说的，经常参与各个项目的投票，可能会收获意想不到的福报。

a.在Layer0上面质押STG参与投票，虽然Stargate已经发币，但是Layer0作为一个公链，不发币是很难维持开支的。类似的操作

b.OP认可的链上投票有：Coumpound、Aave、Curve、Maker、Aragon

**3.2.2 多签**

多签账户不仅能获得额外的空投，而且还有一些豁免权，项目方在各方面的标准都会降低一些，这类账户一般是由DAO的领导者持有。但是也不一定，兔子洞推荐的Gnosis Safe就很适合大家，我们完全可以自己发起一个DAO，然后以DAO的身份参与各种项目。

需要注意的是，OP对多签的要求是链上交易数量要超过10条，未来的空投可能还会继续提高门槛。所以，关于交易数……你懂吧。

gnosis-safe的玩法很多，这里不细说，只做一个小建议，用电脑配手机gnosis app+ metamask app的方式组成两个多签人为一组的多签账号，会比较方便。

**3.2.3Gitcoin捐赠**

这个没什么好说的，在主网交易可以增加交易数量，并且以后可能很多L2项目是不认zksync的捐赠的，想去zksync上省钱的自己注意别捐错了就好。

**3.2.4 主网交互者**

还是那句话，OP是一个注重公益行为的公链，所以保持在主网上的交易记录是一个很好的习惯，缺点就是真的挺贵的，每周等gas低的时候随便。据某社区大神们的推荐，主网上最便宜的操作应该是：走zks官方桥、刷approve、gitcoin捐款、领noox徽章、free mint图狗等。

**3.2.5 交互的资金量**

对比其他空投标准，我们会发现，像OP这样的公链+DAO，对交互的资金是没有要求的，而DEFI类本身就带有金融属性的项目，会考虑你交互的金额。

### 3.3 实战案例

**3.3.1 一鱼多吃**

这个交互方法很早就有了，[@丰密](https://twitter.com/duokongcrypto)应该是这方面的集大成者，他的这篇教程推荐大家都去看看

[https://mirror.xyz/kuiqian.eth/kkaVfNe54p8_wRtKW5uHsRoK6OxSJgJBd7puKTjC6qk](https://mirror.xyz/kuiqian.eth/kkaVfNe54p8_wRtKW5uHsRoK6OxSJgJBd7puKTjC6qk)

很多交互工作我们可以放在一块来做，**例如通过Gnosis创建一些ARB和主网的多签账户，然后参与投票、捐赠、刷主网数据、完成noox成就等工作**。虽然有点费Gas，但是摇身一变，成为DAO负责人，是有可能让你在未来获得超额的收益的。

关于多签的玩法还有很多，比如**Utopia、coinshift**，以及一些DAO工具，考虑到一些不安全因素，需要大家自己去探索，这里就算是抛砖引玉了。

**重要提醒**：多签账户的地址仅支持一个公链，不同的公链请一定创建不同的多签账户，千万不要做[WinterMute那样的傻事](https://mirror.xyz/3webcapital.eth/30d8hQBpe3rQzcDeH3d6hBq5oqqrRAgwdJOl5Jw9dMg)。

**3.3.2 zkSync交互**

zkSync是肯定有大毛的，建议全方位、多角度地交互。

**a.zkSync 1.0 （必做）**

基本操作：ETH通过官方跨链桥跨链-注册[pinata](https://www.pinata.cloud/)并上传图片上链-复制CID后到[wallet.zksync.io/account/nft](http://wallet.zksync.io/account/nft) 自己Mint NFT-zigzag换出usdc-注册并激活Argent钱包-参与Gitcoin捐赠（等下一期）-Orbiter跨链回主网或其他L2

高级：主网上配合多签投票、质押

**b.zkSync 2.0 (testnet）**

测试网的项目大概率不发币，但是可能会提高zks空投时赋予你的权重（multiplier)。这里可以看看水多多分享的zkSync项目集，自己挑一些心仪的项目做做，意思一下就好。

[https://airtable.com/shrt6eK6LvZvUXvOL/tblkUgJJmbCiqr6Fl/viwbsQt9FsWjU64P1?blocks=hide](https://airtable.com/shrt6eK6LvZvUXvOL/tblkUgJJmbCiqr6Fl/viwbsQt9FsWjU64P1?blocks=hide)

**3.3.3 分币**

参与Snapshot投票只需要你有相应的代币或者质押的代币，本身是不花钱的，所以一定要多多参与，我们每个钱包都应该准备一些被看好的投票项目。

使用bebop可以一币换多币，你可能需要一些aave、uni这样的代币，这是由wintermute打造的一个聚合DEX。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XXJ2IrfrXXR-0SEZC0Hvw.png?height=800&width=592)

bebop的缺点是gas略高，但是可以顺便博一下空投，值得试试。想要使用的话得加入discord申请白名单。

[https://discord.gg/bebop](https://discord.gg/bebop)

进入discord验证身份，然后在waitlist处申请，大概需要等待一两天的时间才能通过。

分币后我们可以用相应的代币进行投票。这里推荐一个新投票提示的小工具：

[https://app.boto.io/editor?templateId=918&type=recipe](https://app.boto.io/editor?templateId=918&type=recipe)

要注意，必须在投票开始前持有相应的币才能投票，有的投票需要质押的币，比如vsSTG

## 4.总结

最后我们再来总结、预判一下项目方的预判：

1\.金融属性强的项目往往会有资金门槛，公链可能会放宽条件（stark这种商业公司例外）

2\.项目方查女巫的方式会不断升级

3\.项目方会提高对积极参与链上工作的用户的权重

4\.特定的NFT、ENS、LENS可能有助于获得更多空投

5\.链上存有一定资金（如主网对应ETH，Polygon对应Matic）可能会是某些空投的必要条件

6\.对项目方有多种贡献的用户会获得更高权重的空投（如交互+LP+Role）

7\.不排除二次空投的可能，保留或者质押少许token或许是个明智的选择

8\.用机器人刷交互会导致同样的行为轨迹且安全性欠佳，不建议使用

9\.Argent、Defi Saver、DeBank 、Zerion这些钱包及看板DAPP也集成有交易和投资公告，可适当使用，或许有空投

*本次攻略结束，谢谢大家的信任。*

*喜欢的话可以mint本文的NFT哦。*

[https://twitter.com/YourAirdropEth](https://twitter.com/YourAirdropEth)

body:
## Part 1. DEX Updates

### —   Key Takeaways    —


💡 DODO integrated the Coinbase PAY service and launched a $MAI - $BUSD liquidity mining campaign on BNB Chain. 
 
💡 Sushiswap launched a proposal to form a community oversight committee. 
 
💡 1inch enters into a partnership with KyberSwap to integrate its liquidity; initiated proposal to discuss diversifying 1inch DAO treasury funding to include ETH, WETH, WBTC, DAI, USDT, etc. as coins supported by the treasury. 
 
💡 The overall market volume declined this week compared to last week. The better performing exchanges were DODO, Balancer, Jupiter, Sushiswap; the worse performing exchanges were Synthetix, Curve, etc., with Synthetix dropping significantly, currently out of the top 10.

### —   DEX Roundup    —

**DODO**

* Integrated Coinbase Pay service.
* Launch a $MAI - $BUSD liquidity mining campaign on BNB Chain.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/63U8C-gghKV1vqqpvcu_2.png?height=512&width=1024)

**Paraswap**

* deposited 1M $PSP tokens to their bug bounty through the **[Hats.Finance](https://twitter.com/HatsFinance)** Dapp.

**QuickSwap**

* Posted a [proposal](https://quickswap-layer2.medium.com/quickswap-governance-discussion-should-we-add-a-build-a-farm-feature-powered-by-cryption-network-13ccaca62ee6) on whether they should add a Build-a-Farm Feature powered by Cryption Network.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yWd9njYkqcK2W4JlfLr8z.png?height=675&width=1200)

**SushiSwap**

* Launching the [proposal](https://toshokan.samurais.io/sushi-community-oversight-committee-role/), which aims to form a community oversight committee for community interaction, taking snapshots, multi-signing, approving budgets, and resolving personnel conflicts.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/F25KsMQZTvhW-GQy2IFB2.png?height=675&width=1200)

### —  Market Overview    —

**TraderJoe**

* Integrated Trust Wallet.
* The UI of POOL has been updated to integrate Farm functions on the POOL page, allowing users to add or remove liquidity.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/uOFXplts-02mCn02rFhbq.png?height=1100&width=1314)

**1inch**

* 1inch founder [@k06a](https://twitter.com/k06a) gave a presentation at the [2022 World Economic Forum](https://twitter.com/1inch/status/1545391955278004229?s=20&t=UswAgMxzbrC8mEEtSx8ETA) in Davos.
* Launching the [proposal](https://snapshot.org/#/1inch.eth/proposal/0xddcbeb800fb1ba01c4a4963ab25dc702245c97e10e5c6f74a36e1f5e18e2f97a), which aims to diversify the 1inch DAO coffers, which currently only consist of USDC, the proposal wants to include ETH, WETH, WBTC, DAI, USDT, etc. as coins to be supported by the coffers.
* Launched the [proposal](https://snapshot.org/#/1inch.eth/proposal/0xf232c7f50925954d32f2def1d64d31905346dd96a0fc8bcb6f029d29d0e6208e), which aims to adjust the revenue of the 1inch DAO Treasury.
* Partnered with Kyberswap and established liquidity.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/x1CZAxhKX-yoxN468ZMmH.png?height=1125&width=2000)

**Curve**

* Euro Coin ( stablecoin with 1:1 peg to Euro）backed by full reserves on Curve.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/qM2R447X8J7rmwpK0z9wD.png?height=466&width=1300)

## Part 2.  Data Tracking

### Trading Volume and Market Share Analysis

In terms of trading volume, the overall market was down this week compared to last week. The better performers were DODO, Balancer, Jupiter, and Sushiswap, all of which saw significant gains. The poorer performing exchanges were Synthetix, Curve, etc.

![ Source: Coingecko](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/gIRjS9hE344SpzUhvQS9j.png?height=537&width=898)

In terms of market share, the top three DEXs are Uniswap, Pancakeswap, and Curve, with Pancakeswap overtaking Curve and moving into second place this week, with Uniswap seeing a significant increase in relative share. Synthetix slipped badly and fell out of the top 10, the other poor performers were Defichain and Osmosis, both of which fell out of the top 20.

![Source: Coingecko](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/h2KGIpqcQ6e3pI3scluOc.png?height=473&width=791)

Aggregators on Ether saw a small decrease in market share compared to last week, from 21.35% to 20.39%.

![Source: Dune Analytics](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/QGag62141gGCGBRMb7z87.png?height=313&width=612)

### **Whale Watch**

This week's Whale trades on ETH had minor changes compared to last week, with small to large sized trades remaining more or less the same.

![Source: Dune Analytics](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/n3eG3kfRitP56CDc65_iB.png?height=415&width=1885)

## Part 3. Project Analysis

### Contango

* Contango is a new type of decentralized exchange that offers future contracts as well as a fixed rate market.
* Contango does not use either the AMM mechanism or the order book model. It innovates a market-making mechanism that enables the exchange of tokens through a fixed-rate market by limiting the time to cash.
* Contango is not in long-term operation and still needs to be tested in practice; this means that early participants need to take on liquidity risk, market risk and smart contract risk.

title: 项目方，我预判了你的预判——从5个空投案例分析怎么走在空投标准的前面
body:
*前言：回顾历史我们会发现，从Uniswap到Optimism，空投的标准变得越来越严苛，项目方正在尽一切努力把他们的代币发放到目标人群手上。要想获得足够多的空投，努力刷交互虽然很最重要，但如何走在项目方的空投标准前面才是我们必须要做的功课。*

*如果说猛刷交互是撸毛的1.0版本，那么精确撸到项目方的G点上，应该是撸毛的2.0版本。本文总结了过去值得参考的5个空投标准，并提炼出其中的精华，希望能给大家带来一些启迪，争取预判项目方的预判。*

*正文开始前再要说一句，当我朝着空投的未来趋势和方向做研究的时候，发现未来不过是历史的重复。这一篇攻略中的许多内容都受到了[@Mike8848](https://twitter.com/Mikemoo75197959)、[@丰密](https://twitter.com/duokongcrypto)、[@gm365.eth](https://twitter.com/gm365)、饼干等前辈过去文章的启迪，许多方法和观点已经被各路大神总结的差不多了，我所能做的，就是站在巨人的肩膀上，做一个缝合怪。*

## 正文

Uniswap应该是第一次大家领略到空投魅力的大规模空投，当时的空投也比较简单，所有参与过交互的人都可以领取400uni的空投，随着时间推移，项目方空投代币的规则也越来越复杂。

**正所谓“道高一尺魔高一丈”，今天我们从过去看向未来，大胆地预判一下未来项目方还会玩出什么新花样。**

**温馨提示：本文很长信息量很大，如没耐心可以直接看实战案例部分，也可以收藏下来慢慢看。**

## 1. DYDX/DeversiFi

### 1.1 空投回顾

![DYDX空投分配方案](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/R0-gXzNSw5Q6HY_MRCra0.png?height=516&width=1080)

大约是从DYDX开始，空投的规则变得复杂起来。项目方为不同资金量的用户设置了不同的等级（门槛）。

![DeversiFi空投分配方案](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/VqqNTmSp2Zyixq7NGCW9Q.png?height=291&width=772)

DeversiFi成功吸取了在DYDX的经验，在设置**资金门槛**的基础上，还增加了**活跃度的门槛**，这一规则一直被沿用至现在，包括OP、Across（已提案）在内的各项目方的空投方案都在参考这样的方法。

### 1.2 启示

面对DEFI或跨链桥等需要一定资金的项目时，我们可以通过Dune、Footprint来跟踪项目的交易量，想办法让每个钱包的交易额/跨链量超过一定比例的用户，达到某一个门槛。同时也不要忘记至少每周使用一次要空投的项目，并在各个链上留有一定的资金（大约5-10刀）

### 1.3 实战案例：找到门槛

使用dune查看nomad跨链桥的状态：

[https://dune.com/0xroll/Nomad-Bridge-Ethereum](https://dune.com/0xroll/Nomad-Bridge-Ethereum)

这里我们可以直接引用用户0xroll已经做好的nomad链上分析，这里我们只需要点击\[Nomad Recent Transactions\]这一栏，然后把出来的代码分叉到自己的dune里面，修改一下要查找的交易记录，比如改为1000笔，就能轻松找出大多数人跨链时用了多少资金了。

关于Dune的具体使用方法，可以看看成员[@gm365.eth](https://twitter.com/gm365)的教程，我这里只是一个取巧的办法。

[https://mirror.xyz/gm365.eth](https://mirror.xyz/gm365.eth)

以上只是从资金方面做了分析，活跃度上，我们还需要保持每周一次以上的交互。

## 2. Paraswap/HOP

### 2.1 空投回顾

项目方需要羊毛党的交互的数据，羊毛党需要项目方的空投，两者真正的相爱相杀可能要从Paraswap开始算起，在HOP发币时达到一个巅峰。

![PSP非常严格的空投标准](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iXJq-y1ilSQD4QadU8uXq.png?height=330&width=827)

PSP发币前一直在利用空投PUA用户，拿到融资后立刻执行了更加严格的空投方案——通过修改空投方案，光明正大地把许多用户归为空投猎人，一个币也不给。这让许多普通用户也被反撸，导致了大量的不满，其代币也在空投后在不断地贬值，这个故事在HOP上延续着。

![HOP空头标准，资金量和LP是重点](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/6ZCDWu6ccvBNFg22M6Qp9.png?height=425&width=737)

虽然后来的OP也同样不欢迎女巫，但是HOP让用户相互举报女巫的行为可谓是所有空投标准中的“集大成”者，这一次许多撸毛党都栽在了这里。

![区块律动上的一篇案例分析](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/tWjxMuHm5-rloKFdgt2wF.png?height=585&width=830)

### 2.2 启示

**2.2.1 避免资金归集**。

目前来看，使用交易所归集、分发是最稳妥、省钱的方法，需要注意的是，存款的时候应该存入子账号，避免全部转入相同地址后被认定为女巫。

**2.2.2 混肴操作**。

根据早先一些被举报案例的报道，项目方主要通过资金归集、操作相似、时间相同、社交网络泄露地址并被举报等方式来鉴定女巫。

所以我们的在交互的时候至少应该避免以上的操作方式，同时还应该具备一定的前瞻性，把IP、浏览器痕迹（cookie）都考虑进来。

### 2.3 实战案例

**2.3.1 账号隔离**

这里介绍一下我自己防女巫的操作方法：

![我的操作方式](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/k-q44WjgI6YJJQvHOrZ9S.png?height=780&width=691)

a.使用多台电脑，每台电脑使用不同的VPN，保证IP不重复，平常使用chrome浏览器，且不接受任何cookie，用不同的谷歌账号开子浏览器管理钱包

b.每个谷歌账号中只有一套助记词（方便管理），助记词下配一个精撸账号（即有ENS、有大量交易纪录等）和5个以内的子钱包（可以互相转账，方便操作），组成一个钱包集

c.钱包集之间互相不能转账，严格隔离

d.一般情况下不使用批量刷的软件，一是保证钱包安全，二是避免被女巫

e.不明来源文件使用虚拟机打开，浏览器精简不必要的插件，不要心怀侥幸。

**2.3.2 交易所相关操作**

**a.归集资金**

中心化交易所仍然是最方便的跨链/隐私协议，资金归集的时候可以使用OKX、币安、FTX这些交易所。但是你的交易所钱包是固定的，**所以归集资金时应该创建子账号，不同钱包集的资金打入不同的账号**。

**b.分发资金**

我最近开始使用Layerswap来分撒资金，这是一个为交易所提供跨链功能的DAPP归集

![交易所跨链项目Layeswap](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/chJtAc_guTCASOQeh0akU.png?height=691&width=769)

使用这个DAPP，你需要获得交易所的API，注册Bransfer和Layerswap账户，步骤挺繁琐，但是不排除空投的可能，所以既然要转账，不如试试看。

篇幅有限，具体方法就不介绍了，这里找到一个参考的教程，时间有点早了，不保障完全可用。作者好像是[@baikaishui](https://twitter.com/0xbaikaishui)，未仔细核实。

[https://mirror.xyz/xunfa.eth/7eyIdL99aPVp-esIN0iH_YXApRkXjxIpoQt2sBcfvSM](https://mirror.xyz/xunfa.eth/7eyIdL99aPVp-esIN0iH_YXApRkXjxIpoQt2sBcfvSM)

当然，你也可以使用zkMoney归集资金，这也是一个必刷的协议，这类金融类产品最好增加交互的金额，提高你的空投权重（如果有的话）。

[https://zk.money/](https://zk.money/)

**2.3.3 操作随机**

我们的交互至少应该做到部分随机，以我自己为例，相同的交互操作每天只能在两个钱包集以内的账号上完成，且做到以下几点：

a.避免交互后立即反向操作，如跨链后立即跨回，交易usdt后立即买回原来的币

b.时间随机，一个钱包集交互后暂停一天以上的时间再做其他操作，如跨链后间隔三天再回到其他链

c.每个账户使用的金额完全随机，如有的钱包使用1eth交互，有的钱包使用0.2eth交互

## 3. Optimism

### 3.1 空投回顾

![原文链接：https://community.optimism.io/docs/governance/airdrop-1/#active-ethereum-participants](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/vCfG2BkIu2Aznl-bde_vx.png?height=394&width=812)

有PSP和HOP的前车之鉴，Optimism的空投方案可谓是集大成者，既照顾了普通用户，也没有对羊毛党赶尽杀绝，很好的达到了项目方推广自己代币的同时又回馈忠实用户的目的\~\~，可惜被WinterMute玩崩了\~\~。

可以看到，OP作为一个由**DAO**构成的L2**公链**，十分注重链上公益行为。

这里我们把空投方案的细则一条条拉出来详细讲解。

### 3.2 启示

**3.2.1 链上投票**

这个没什么好说的，经常参与各个项目的投票，可能会收获意想不到的福报。

a.在Layer0上面质押STG参与投票，虽然Stargate已经发币，但是Layer0作为一个公链，不发币是很难维持开支的。类似的操作

b.OP认可的链上投票有：Coumpound、Aave、Curve、Maker、Aragon

**3.2.2 多签**

多签账户不仅能获得额外的空投，而且还有一些豁免权，项目方在各方面的标准都会降低一些，这类账户一般是由DAO的领导者持有。但是也不一定，兔子洞推荐的Gnosis Safe就很适合大家，我们完全可以自己发起一个DAO，然后以DAO的身份参与各种项目。

需要注意的是，OP对多签的要求是链上交易数量要超过10条，未来的空投可能还会继续提高门槛。所以，关于交易数……你懂吧。

gnosis-safe的玩法很多，这里不细说，只做一个小建议，用电脑配手机gnosis app+ metamask app的方式组成两个多签人为一组的多签账号，会比较方便。

**3.2.3Gitcoin捐赠**

这个没什么好说的，在主网交易可以增加交易数量，并且以后可能很多L2项目是不认zksync的捐赠的，想去zksync上省钱的自己注意别捐错了就好。

**3.2.4 主网交互者**

还是那句话，OP是一个注重公益行为的公链，所以保持在主网上的交易记录是一个很好的习惯，缺点就是真的挺贵的，每周等gas低的时候随便。据某社区大神们的推荐，主网上最便宜的操作应该是：走zks官方桥、刷approve、gitcoin捐款、领noox徽章、free mint图狗等。

**3.2.5 交互的资金量**

对比其他空投标准，我们会发现，像OP这样的公链+DAO，对交互的资金是没有要求的，而DEFI类本身就带有金融属性的项目，会考虑你交互的金额。

### 3.3 实战案例

**3.3.1 一鱼多吃**

这个交互方法很早就有了，[@丰密](https://twitter.com/duokongcrypto)应该是这方面的集大成者，他的这篇教程推荐大家都去看看

[https://mirror.xyz/kuiqian.eth/kkaVfNe54p8_wRtKW5uHsRoK6OxSJgJBd7puKTjC6qk](https://mirror.xyz/kuiqian.eth/kkaVfNe54p8_wRtKW5uHsRoK6OxSJgJBd7puKTjC6qk)

很多交互工作我们可以放在一块来做，**例如通过Gnosis创建一些ARB和主网的多签账户，然后参与投票、捐赠、刷主网数据、完成noox成就等工作**。虽然有点费Gas，但是摇身一变，成为DAO负责人，是有可能让你在未来获得超额的收益的。

关于多签的玩法还有很多，比如**Utopia、coinshift**，以及一些DAO工具，考虑到一些不安全因素，需要大家自己去探索，这里就算是抛砖引玉了。

**重要提醒**：多签账户的地址仅支持一个公链，不同的公链请一定创建不同的多签账户，千万不要做[WinterMute那样的傻事](https://mirror.xyz/3webcapital.eth/30d8hQBpe3rQzcDeH3d6hBq5oqqrRAgwdJOl5Jw9dMg)。

**3.3.2 zkSync交互**

zkSync是肯定有大毛的，建议全方位、多角度地交互。

**a.zkSync 1.0 （必做）**

基本操作：ETH通过官方跨链桥跨链-注册[pinata](https://www.pinata.cloud/)并上传图片上链-复制CID后到[wallet.zksync.io/account/nft](http://wallet.zksync.io/account/nft) 自己Mint NFT-zigzag换出usdc-注册并激活Argent钱包-参与Gitcoin捐赠（等下一期）-Orbiter跨链回主网或其他L2

高级：主网上配合多签投票、质押（注意不能跨链）、ENS

**b.zkSync 2.0 (testnet）**

测试网的项目大概率不发币，但是可能会提高zks空投时赋予你的权重（multiplier)。这里可以看看水多多分享的zkSync项目集，自己挑一些心仪的项目做做，意思一下就好。

[https://airtable.com/shrt6eK6LvZvUXvOL/tblkUgJJmbCiqr6Fl/viwbsQt9FsWjU64P1?blocks=hide](https://airtable.com/shrt6eK6LvZvUXvOL/tblkUgJJmbCiqr6Fl/viwbsQt9FsWjU64P1?blocks=hide)

**3.3.3 分币**

参与Snapshot投票只需要你有相应的代币或者质押的代币，本身是不花钱的，所以一定要多多参与，我们每个钱包都应该准备一些被看好的投票项目。

使用bebop可以一币换多币，你可能需要一些aave、uni这样的代币，这是由wintermute打造的一个聚合DEX。

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/XXJ2IrfrXXR-0SEZC0Hvw.png?height=800&width=592)

bebop的缺点是gas略高，但是可以顺便博一下空投，值得试试。想要使用的话得加入discord申请白名单。

[https://discord.gg/bebop](https://discord.gg/bebop)

进入discord验证身份，然后在waitlist处申请，大概需要等待一两天的时间才能通过。

分币后我们可以用相应的代币进行投票。这里推荐一个新投票提示的小工具：

[https://app.boto.io/editor?templateId=918&type=recipe](https://app.boto.io/editor?templateId=918&type=recipe)

要注意，必须在投票开始前持有相应的币才能投票，有的投票需要质押的币，比如vsSTG

## 4.总结

最后我们再来总结、预判一下项目方的预判：

1\.金融属性强的项目往往会有资金门槛，公链可能会放宽条件（stark这种商业公司例外）

2\.项目方查女巫的方式会不断升级

3\.项目方会提高对积极参与链上工作的用户的权重

4\.特定的NFT、ENS、LENS可能有助于获得更多空投

5\.链上存有一定资金（如主网对应ETH，Polygon对应Matic）可能会是某些空投的必要条件

6\.对项目方有多种贡献的用户会获得更高权重的空投（如交互+LP+Role）

7\.不排除二次空投的可能，保留或者质押少许token或许是个明智的选择

8\.用机器人刷交互会导致同样的行为轨迹且安全性欠佳，不建议使用

9\.Argent、Defi Saver、DeBank 、Zerion这些钱包及看板DAPP也集成有交易和投资公告，可适当使用，或许有空投

*本次攻略结束，谢谢大家的信任。*

*喜欢的话可以mint本文的NFT哦。*

title: 林远
body:
红霞漫天，太阳缓缓从海平面上升起，朝霞渐渐照亮了凌晨六点的青山市。 
  
 　　青山市别墅区的一处庭院内，一个黑色碎发的少年赤裸着上身，调动着全身的肌肉不断的向前冲拳。 
  
 　　“999！” 
  
 　　“1000！” 
  
 　　“呼……” 
  
 　　完成了日复一日的清晨训练，林远拿起一旁的毛巾擦了擦满是汗水的脸颊，舒展了一下筋骨，随后便朝着别墅内走去。 
  
 　　简单的冲了个凉，做好早餐之后，林远推开了其中一个卧室的房门，一大脚蹬在床上那个四仰八叉的黄发少年身上。 
  
 　　“吴敌，到点了。” 
  
 　　吴敌被踹的翻了个身，意识模糊的呢喃着。 
  
 　　“啊……” 
  
 　　“嗯……” 
  
 　　“赶紧的，给你五秒钟时间。” 
  
 　　“要不然给你小裤衩艺术照放网上去。” 
  
 　　作为十几年的死党，林远把吴敌拿捏的死死的。 
  
 　　果然这话一出，吴敌双手抱头从床上蹿腾了起来，惨嚎声中听出了一丝想把林远掐死的冲动： 
  
 　　“啊——” 
  
 　　“林远！” 
  
 　　“远哥！” 
  
 　　“你饶了我吧！” 
  
 　　他可是堂堂迷倒青山市万千少女，高校帅哥榜排名第124的吴敌啊！ 
  
 　　吴敌很清楚林远这货真干的出来这事。 
  
 　　“赶紧的。” 
  
 　　“九点的武道课。” 
  
 　　“早点去。” 
  
 　　林远完全无视了吴敌的惨嚎，留下了一个冷漠的背影。 
  
 　　“啊——” 
  
 　　…… 
  
 　　别墅的餐桌上，林远一边吃着早餐，一边翻阅着手中关于“灵种”的书籍。 
  
 　　严格来说，林远并不完全是这个世界的人。 
  
 　　肌萎缩侧索硬化症，又称渐冻人症，五大绝症之一。 
  
 　　前世二十一岁的他因为渐冻人症病死之后，再醒来之时已经来到了这个名为“苍澜星”的一级文明世界。 
  
 　　对于死过一次的林远来说，自然极其珍惜这一次重生的机会。 
  
 　　其中早在原来的地球世界，科学家就对一级文明有所定义。 
  
 　　定义为可以控制星球上的天然能量。 
  
 　　通俗一点就是灵力。 
  
 　　天水国制定的武道总纲，第一句话就是“天地之间有呼吸，这一道呼吸就是灵气，充盈于天地之间”。 
  
 　　这是一个灵武之风盛行的世界。 
  
 　　吴敌洗漱完毕，懵懵的坐到了位置上，拿起林远已经做好的早餐机械般的咀嚼着。 
  
 　　吃着吃着缓缓伏在了桌子上，如同一具尸体。

早上清理手机应用，发现之前玩期货的一个平台竟然还给我空投了10刀😬

title: The Secret Potential of xPRISM
body:
## A deep dive into the current and future yield that xPRISM will earn for stakers.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*DNLs-eI3YXB3FZPDuK234A.png)

Many of us have already seen the threads and videos about Prism, and are familiar with how it works. For those who need a primer, check out @pLunaDAO’s thread on Twitter [here](https://twitter.com/pLUNADAO/status/1505966074356981773). A quick recap, however:

Prism Protocol allows you to refract, or split, assets into their principle (called the pToken) and yield-bearing (yToken) components. For example, think of splitting Luna into 2 tokens, one is *only* it’s price exposure, and the other is *only* it’s staking yield. Now you can sell off the piece you don’t want, and get bonus exposure to which one you *do* want. Leveraged staking yield with reduced price exposure? Yes please! In the future, which we will discuss, refracting will be coming to other tokens with staking yield, as well as interest bearing tokens such as LP positions.

## Current State

With a basic understanding of Prism, we can now discuss the protocol’s current state. At the moment, Prism is in its infancy. The only asset available to refract is Luna. Still, Prism has **4.5M Luna refracted, representing nearly half a billion dollars of value**. This tells us that protocol interest is massive, even before the majority of its core features are developed. With this much TVL from a simple first stage product, just how much TVL can be achieved when ETH holders can refract, and expiry p/y assets are in wide use? More TVL means substantially more profit for xPrism holders, which we will get into.

![That’s a lot of staking yield.](https://miro.medium.com/max/366/1\*GxFvcKZKfaAs6U5hpuQMKA.png)

For the moment, users can stake their yLuna in the regular staking vault for \~9% APR. This is a decent bump compared to what regular Luna staking’s 6%, because yLuna is *cheaper* than Luna, but gets *all* of Luna’s staking yield. Selling off pLuna to get more yLuna gives even more APR compared to ordinary Luna.

Additionally, and the main attraction at the moment, is the Prism farm. With the Prism farm, yLuna stakers can opt instead to stake here to earn Prism tokens instead of Luna. I’ll say it outright — **this is by far the best opportunity on all of Terra right now.** The Prism farm, paying out an attractive yield of 32%, is about 4x higher than most other Luna-only opportunities like regular staking (6%) or using Nexus’s vault (8%). This yield can be boosted even higher using Prism’s AMPs mechanism. Read more about that [here](https://prism-protocol.medium.com/how-to-turbo-charge-your-yluna-yield-827fc244ab6).

![Both yLuna staking opportunities on Prism Protocol.](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*hpKtOEVYSL2fS93-ry38jQ.png)

pLuna, the sister token of yLuna, has comparatively less opportunities at the moment. For now, you can provide it on Edge Protocol for others to borrow, or LP with it on Loop Finance or on Prism’s own DEX. You can also simply hold it, since yLuna stakers will be forced to pry it out of your cold hands if they ever want to get back to unrefracted Luna. More uses will be coming in the future, however, so feel free to speculate on it’s future value.

## Prism distribution

The first thing we need to understand is the tokenomics and revenue sources of xPrism. The most important aspect of distribution is that **Prism has no liquidity incentives.** What does this mean? It means that Liquidity providers are all doing it for only swap fees. Because all LP pairs are Prism on one side, this inherently means they believe in the future of the token, and are likely to be more loyal to the token (read: won’t pump and dump). Many protocols that fuel their initial liquidity with endless emissions skyrocket as people FOMO into the farm, then dump 50–75% in a week as emissions outpace demand.

![Current APRs offered for LPing with Prism. Rewards are purely from swap fees.](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*HLUYo72tjyeO-SG4T03_DA.png)

This is not an issue Prism faces, because their emissions are already under tight control. Initial token buyers during the public Lockdrop did not get their tokens for free, so any initial buyers won’t be dumping below their cost basis. yLuna stakers in the Prism farm are not really getting their tokens for free. The emissions are a slow burn over a whole year, and very importantly, all the yLuna yield in that farm is going to the protocol’s treasury to cover protocol activities and operating cost. PRISM farmers are paying with their staking yield. How much revenue is this? About 18.7 million dollars assuming no more yLuna joins the Prism farm (bold assumption). This gives Prism plenty of margin to operate. This means partnerships, marketing, and quality developers.

All this is to say that Prism doesn’t hand out tokens to just anybody. There are **no free Prism tokens**, meaning there are no mercenary yield farmers earning free rewards and dumping on our faces. The methods of token distribution are high quality, and means that Prism is not your average DEX or farm token, emitting until it hits zero. Prism’s investor base paid good money for their tokens, and they sure aren’t going to sell at a loss.

*Prism is a high quality token with a selective investor base.*

## Income sources for xPrism holders

Understanding the methods of distribution, we can talk about the exciting part, sources of revenue. As of right now, xPrism holders already accrue a significant amount of revenue even with the project not having a fraction of it’s core features. Despite this, the APR for xPrism holders has remained consistently high for single-sided staking, despite having a massive *85%* of total supply staked.

![Yield earned for holding xPrism.](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*LmB18PlBMQuJJ2mdC_GagQ.png)

As mentioned before, there are no Prism emissions, so all the yield earned by xPrism stakers is 100% protocol revenue.

This protocol revenue/APR is driven by a few things right now. From the docs, these are:

1. **10% of the yield of yASSETs bonded in PRISM  
 **This means any yLuna in the yLuna staking still has 10% of it’s staking yield directed to xPrism stakers. Currently, this is about $0.76M per year, more when the Prism farm ends.
2. **100% of the yield of unbonded assets 
 **Any yLuna that is being used to provide LP, or is otherwise not in the yLuna staking gives up 100% of its yield to xPrism holders. About another $1M per year, excluding the PRISM farm.
3. **0.1% of the value of all swaps generated in PRISM Swap** 
 Any trade executed on the PRISM swap has 0.1% of it’s value redirected to xPrism holders. More volume = more revenue.
4. **0.3% of the value of all limit orders successfully executed in PRISM 
 **Limit orders are the *next major feature coming to Prism.* They allow for users to set a price to purchase an asset, and then automatically have the protocol buy it for them once that price is reached. 0.3% of the value of this swap will be granted to xPrism holders.

Overall, these revenue sources are simple. However, they are powerful. Sources one and two mean that even should the Prism DEX experience low usage (*highly unlikely*.), xPrism holders still collect revenue from Luna’s own staking yield, meaning the success and income of xPrism is inherently linked to the success and income of Luna, which everyone reading this article should be bullish on.

## The future of protocol revenue

Here’s the long awaited kicker. A bit further down the pipeline, Prism will be introducing y/p assets with expiry dates. This means that when refracted for a predetermined amount of time, the yAsset will give out all the yield over that period, and at the end, the pAsset can be redeemed for a regular unit of the underlying. More clearly: Refracting Luna with a 6 month expiry will give you a yLuna that pays staking yield for the next 6 months, and a pLuna that will be redeemable for Luna after 6 months have passed.

This expiry model opens up all sorts of amazing opportunities for everyone involved.

Want free yield with no price exposure? Pick up $1000 of cash flow over the next 6 months at only $500 right now.

Are you a long term Luna investor looking to stack at a discount? Buy some 12-month expiry pLuna at a 10% discount, get a full Luna after the year is up.

Already stacked? Refract and sell your yLuna over and over again to rack up that precious Luna or UST.

Just a humble xPrism holder? *Collect 10% of that yield regardless.*

Expiry assets also open up massive opportunities for ecosystem integration. Imagine selling your yLuna to a protocol at a discount, and getting the full cash value of it up front. The protocol stakes and chills, ultimately coming out ahead over the long run.

Another hypothetical protocol could offer a Luna vault that automagically stacks pLuna, getting smooth returns for users as each pLuna matures into a full Luna.

**Additionally,** Prism is not stopping at Luna. In the very near future, Prism will allow refracting to **yEth and pEth**. This essentially doubles xPrism revenue overnight, as more assets means more yield collected by xPrism stakers. In the future, LP tokens will also be refractable. Sell off the principle component of your LP, sit back, and enjoy the yield without price exposure. Eventually, we may even see Solana, Atom, Polkadot, and other staking-enabled tokens.

All in all, xPrism is a value accrual monster, whether new investors buy in or not. The longer you hold xPrism, the more Prism you’re gifted, all *paid* for by the protocol, **never** free or from emissions.

xPrism already has a fantastic loyal investor base, as demonstrated by it’s deep liquidity in *unincentivized* LP pools. We could discuss the genius mechanisms the developers have implemented such as AMPs, or the upcoming partnerships like Edge, but those are for another article.

To understate: xPrism earns a ton of revenue already, and that income is only going up. An investment in xPrism is an investment in all yield-bearing assets, and yield is not going away any time soon.

Links: 
 Prism Protocol: <https://prismprotocol.app/> 
 Prism docs: <https://docs.prismprotocol.app/> 
 My Twitter: <https://twitter.com/defi_dm> 
 Prism Discord (I’m dm#0477): <https://discord.gg/wvfJGMrexN> 
 Prism Telegram: <https://t.me/Prism_Protocol>

title: New Aliens game will be single-player and likely terrifying in VR
body:
A new game based on the Alien franchise is coming to consoles, PC, and virtual reality platforms, promising an “intense single-player, action horror game” experience set in the sci-fi franchise. 20th Century Games and Survios, the developer behind VR games like *Creed: Rise to Glory*, *Raw Data*, and *Sprint Vector*, say their untitled project will be “an untold Aliens story” set during the 57-year gap between the events of the original *Alien* and sequel, *Aliens*.

The new Aliens game will star a battle-hardened veteran has a vendetta against the Xenomorphs, according to [the game’s official website](https://survios.com/Aliens/). Survios says its project will build on the studio’s “expertise in creating immersive and authentic gaming experiences.” The game is being built using Epic Games’ Unreal Engine 5.

20th Century Games and Survios say more details will be revealed at next week’s Comic-Con in San Diego, at the Alien: Expanding a Dark and Frightening Universe panel on July 21.

Beyond that, we don’t know much about the next big Aliens game, but it sounds like it could satisfy fans of 2014’s *[Alien: Isolation](https://www.polygon.com/game/alien-isolation/36025)*, the single-player survival horror game (that was similarly set between *Alien* and *Aliens*) from developer Creative Assembly. That studio is currently working on something very different: an over-the-top loot-driven shooter called *[Hyenas](https://www.polygon.com/23178631/hyenas-sega-creative-assembly-release-date-trailer-announcement)*.

title: The simple explanation of Retrograde and Astroport
body:
## Terra’s version of Convex and Curve.

To begin, I’ve made a thread with most of this information on Twitter already, but wanted to write an article so I could add in a lot more detail, as well as use the long-form format of a document. See that thread [here](https://twitter.com/defi_dm/status/1511183588712075269), and feel free to send me ideas or feedback for what you’d like to see explored or explained.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0\*6DyCQ6IL5c-7qd5N.png)

## How Astroport’s vxAstro works

Astroport has announced that in the near future, they will be implementing a veToken model for staked Astro, or xAstro. Astro is their reward token given to farmers, and staking Astro grants xAstro, which is the governance/revenue accruing token.

Switching to a veToken model means that users will be able to lock their xAstro for a selected amount of time and receive vxAstro. vxAstro boosts LP yield, and gives more voting power. Importantly, vxAstro is non-transferrable, and non-redeemable. In other words, once you lock your xAstro, you cannot do anything with it until your time lock expires.

The *amount* of vxAstro a user gets increases with how long they lock the xAstro. Locking your xAstro for 4 years gives exponentially more than 3 months. This means users are incentivized to lock for as long as possible to get the most rewards.

This is identical to how Curve works on Ethereum.

![Astro’s got some new tricks up it’s sleeve.](https://miro.medium.com/max/634/1\*F_tnTLT5WFLyYnntfCHO5w.png)

## The Problem for LPs

Locking xAstro is undesirable for your average farmer and retail LP. Because defi moves so quickly and DEX tokens can lose their value quickly due to emissions, most LPs are scared of committing their funds to xAstro for months, let alone the 4+ years required for maximum LP rewards/voting power. They would rather sell their Astro to get more LP. Many farmers could also not care less about voting rights, as they are in the farms to get paid, not have influence.

Even *if* a retail LP was totally willing to lock their Astro for 4 years, it’s unlikely they would even have the right amount of Astro to achieve the maximum boost attainable for their LP. This gives retail LPs another reason to just dump their Astro instead of locking it, since they cannot realistically achieve all the benefit associated with the risk of locking.

## The Problem for Protocols

Another major issue with the veToken model is for protocols. Protocols want Astro emissions on their own pools when they launch their tokens. This helps people buy into their coin to provide liquidity. LPs want a chunk of Astro emissions on top of the regular swap fees and incentives, because Dual Rewards pools attract major liquidity as well as buying pressure. This then allows for traders to swap in with low slippage.

If a protocol wants to direct Astro emissions to their new project’s pool, they have to somehow convince vxAstro holders to vote for them week after week. Most people don’t even vote in their national elections once a year, how can you convince defi users to vote once a *week*?

The alternative route is to shell out millions of dollars to buy and lock enough xAstro to direct emissions to their own project’s pool.

Both these options suck for new projects, as they don’t have anywhere near the budget to buy enough Astro to get emissions on their pool through voting, or convince users to vote.

So, how do we solve all these issues at once? Introducing Retrograde Money. The geniuses over at Retrograde have already setup the system for everyone, including themselves, to win.

## Here comes…Retrograde!

![www.retrograde.money](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*qh-Gn_jClVsyIdxY8GByaA.png)

First off, Retrograde aims to stack as much xAstro as possible, and lock it for as long as Astroport will let them.This gives Retrograde:1.) Maximum LP earnings2.) Maximum voting power

Obviously the xAstro isn’t free, so how will they secure it?

Retrograde will **promise LPs boosted yields using their vxAstro pool**, since they’ll always have more xAstro than any individual, allowing for more boost than the average user will be able to get for themselves. Users will get this boosted yield while having no exposure to Astro itself

In addition to compensate, Retrograde will give the user a wrapper token that represents the underlying locked xAstro. This token will be called retroAstro. The retroAstro represents the underlying locked xAstro, but can be traded freely. If Convex is any indicator, retroAstro will trade almost 1:1 to xAstro itself. They will also get paid in Retro’s own token.

Retail LPs can now deposit their LP tokens along with any Astro they have into Retrograde, and receive the boosted yield with no additional risk of locked tokens or Astro exposure. The protocol retains and locks the Astro they earn, but pays the user in retroAstro instead.

Both LPs and Retrograde win using this model.

But what about other protocols who want Astro emissions? Here’s where it gets cool.

With Retrograde, **protocols can leverage their funds by bribing Retrograde** to use their vast amounts of vxAstro to vote for their project to receive emissions.

Instead of needing to buy 10m in xAstro, just pay Retrograde a fraction to vote for emissions for your pool for the week. Because LPs forfeit their xAstro to Retrograde for the increased yield, Retrograde has full discretion to use its voting power on whatever pools they are “bribed” to vote for.

With this, every party involved truly wins.

**Retrograde:** keeps a share of the vxAstro rewards to distribute to its stakers. Also gets the bribe money from protocols to distribute as well. 
 **Retail LPs:** get boosted emissions at no cost. Give up the voting rights they weren’t going to use in order to get higher yield.**Protocols:** can vote without needing to buy costly amounts of xAstro. 
 **Astroport:** has a reliable blackhole, since Retro never sells or dumps xAstro back onto the market.

Here is a graphic with an overview made by one of Retro’s team members, [DetectiveGrover](https://twitter.com/detectivegrover):

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/0\*L9s_0SAv8OD1fppx)

## Conclusion

Retrograde is providing a valuable middle ground between Astroport’s vxAstro and all the users that interact with it. They essentially strip the voting rights from those who don’t care for them, and leverage them for those that do. This aligns the xAstro token with the interests of both parties, without wasting utility on those that don’t want it.

Hopefully this article helps you understand the value proposition that Retrograde is bringing to Astroport and Terra as a whole! Feel free to give me any feedback and *especially* let me know what you want to see articles on, whether it be protocols, mechanisms, or general defi concepts. I’m trying to share my Terra and defi knowledge with all my fellow Lunatics.

## P.S. Some Potential Prism/Retrograde Alpha

Prism Protocol also has a similar mechanism as vxAstro. Pledging xPrism in their AMPs vault provides boosted yield the longer AMPs are allowed to accrue. The team has said that AMPs will also allows increased governance power whenever their governance system rolls around.

As I covered in my last article on the [Future Revenue Streams of xPrism](https://medium.com/@defi_dm/the-secret-potential-of-xprism-df053cf11ac), LPs on the Prism Swap are not incentivized with additional tokens. Incentives will be added in the future, but they are not needed for now according to the Prism team. **These yields will be boosted by AMPs** as mentioned by a core team member during an AMA earlier this week.

When Prism adds LP incentives, Retrograde could easily swoop in and start locking up xPrism forever to boost yields for all our LP friends. Nothing like this has been announced yet, but given the similar nature of xAstro and xPrism, this is not far fetched at all.

Feel free to follow me here on Medium or on my [Twitter](https://twitter.com/defi_dm) if you want more of my content.

title: 天水军校
body:
“你认真的？” 
  
 　　吴敌呆呆的望着林远，以他对林远的了解，现在林远的表情不像是在开玩笑。 
  
 　　林远微微一笑，“认真的啊。” 
  
 　　吴敌不解的摊手道： 
  
 　　“为什么啊？” 
  
 　　天水军校，这是所有武道学院之中死亡率最高的学院，没有之一。 
  
 　　而且军校的门槛并不低，文科武科都需要良好的成绩。 
  
 　　听到吴敌的话，林远伸出了三根手指： 
  
 　　“三个原因。” 
  
 　　“第一个原因，资源。” 
  
 　　资源两个字刚刚说出之时，吴敌便当场一愣，显然想通了一些原因。 
  
 　　天水军校，这是由天水国国家军部建立的。 
  
 　　最初的时候是在武道学院内部进行招募。 
  
 　　在几十年前直接演变成了军校，直接从十八岁左右的高中生进行招募，扩充国家兵力，培养战士。 
  
 　　最重要的是由国家提供资源进行培养，和顶级的武道学院有所不同。 
  
 　　家庭条件一般的武者，就算进入到顶级的武道学院之中，如果没有那么顶级的天赋，很有可能会因为资源稀缺，而淹没在天才的竞争较量之中。 
  
 　　所以军校对于林远来说是一个很正常的选择。 
  
 　　林远伸出第二根手指，道： 
  
 　　“第二，我的机械系灵种。” 
  
 　　“我已经查过了，只有天水军校才有机械系的强者。” 
  
 　　吴敌更加沉默。 
  
 　　这确实也是一个很现实的因素。 
  
 　　林远的机械系灵种实在是太稀有了。 
  
 　　至少他也没听说过那几所武道学院中有哪位强者是机械系的。 
  
 　　没有同系的老师指导，林远的发展前途相当有限。 
  
 　　“第三。” 
  
 　　林远伸出第三根手指，耸了耸肩道：

title: Crisis (The Album)
body:
↳ Project page: [crisisthealbum.xyz](https://www.crisisthealbum.xyz/) 
 ↳ Twitter: [@crisisthealbum](https://twitter.com/crisisthealbum)

1. Introduction
2. Season 00 – The Story
3. Process
4. Seasons 01-09
5. Outlook

## Introduction

In its most basic form, *Crisis* is the debut album of Valentin Hansen, co-produced and released by Killing A Friend. In a broader sense, *Crisis* is an ongoing multi-media, multi-level experiment that explores alternative ideas for the distribution and exploitation of musical works. It is the journey of an album that defied the dominant structures of its system in order to break new ground.

This project aims to align *releases* ↔︎ *value* ↔︎ *community* into one common narrative. Read more about the process below.

## Season 00 – The Story

One year ago the journey of Crisis began with the release of *[Crisis (The Worthless Album)](https://open.spotify.com/album/7nwbv2tj8q9OTWhin3ZBsm).* What had been planned as a traditional release, changed due to a pivotal decision.

The album was cut into 30 pieces, each 29 seconds long. Since a stream only starts counting after 30 seconds of playtime, it can't collect plays or earn any revenue, no matter how much it's listened to. The value of this album is 0.000$

Ultimately, this is the only way to choose one's own value in the current system of being patronised by a pro-rata system (streaming) of big tech and major labels. By releasing an album this way, it reveals quite the imbalance and absurdity of the music industry's current monetisation model and asks if centralised platforms should define the value of art according to a demand-supply calculation. Or, instead, shall creators regain complete control over the value they create.

> "*Valentin Hansen released an album in a way that’s never been done before. In doing so, he highlighted the unprecedented shift in how music is being made as a direct result of the rule.*"
> — Brian Harrington, [The Album That's Worth Nothing](https://deathbyalgorithm.substack.com/p/the-album-thats-worth-nothing)

No matter how many of the industry tricks we utilised, we ended up in a zero-sum game.

![An exhibition with a click farm. Multiple phones were streaming the album day and night. Stream count: 0](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/yDX5NZ9QkjYJJXEbu4-0q.png?height=1490&width=3070)

![Vinyl records were being sold in 14 cities worldwide. Retail price: 0.00 $ € £ ₽ ₩](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/rIQn5Iqm0bbR5OW3Wy_OU.png?height=1984&width=3062)

![Spotify’s 2021 wrapped looked as expected: 0 Streams, 0 Listeners, 0 Hours, 0 Countries](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/kKPpqY4bmsyioxNArLKFr.png?height=1024&width=1024)

## Process

*Crisis (The Album)* will now embark on a multi-level journey to be transformed and have its monetary and cultural worth evaluated by the community. To put it more simply, we will distribute ownership of *Crisis* during 9+ seasons.

Therefore, the original album was minted as one piece of music on [Catalog](https://beta.catalog.works/valentinhansen/crisis-the-album-).

Ownership of this NFT will be represented by each season's tokens (editions of NFTs), with 50% of the shares being transferred within the first nine seasons. Additionally, each season represents the album in its current form. As seasonal NFTs are collected, the album starts to change visually, sonically, & experientially until that particular season sells out.

Upon sellout, a new season unlocks, shape- shifting the album once more and unlocking further experiences, products, visuals, etc.

The remaining 50% will be allocated in season 10. This way—when the album becomes the most expensive work of music ever sold—it'll be fully owned by the community that helped it reach this status.

![](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/iIhgeVic-qPXG15O8qcM5.jpg?height=2589&width=2767)

The journey will continue as long as people keep unlocking the next chapter. Season NFTs will be sold in the form of editions on Mirror.

## Season 01: The Valuable Album

[edition://0x70Fcf72A3355FD64cd7dd9aAd1ABAFB07D1b1b57?editionId=0](edition://0x70Fcf72A3355FD64cd7dd9aAd1ABAFB07D1b1b57?editionId=0)

~~S-00 Crisis (The Worthless Album)~~

This is the catalyst season that kicks off the adventure of the album to attempt to become the most valuable work of music ever to be sold.

As Season 01's NFT is collected, *Crisis (The Worthless Album)* will no longer be worthless and become *Crisis (The Valuable Album)*. It'll now be released on DSPs in its originally intended form.

↳ Update: *Crisis The Valuable Album* is now on [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/album/4a6IvxrxDGkPzgIDuUyx02?si=LcVCa3VVQtyb8wivenM8WA)

## Season 02: The Raw Album

[edition://0x2cF96784dA9a6Ce53b7Dc001BA1B789Ce945FfD3?editionId=0](edition://0x2cF96784dA9a6Ce53b7Dc001BA1B789Ce945FfD3?editionId=0)

~~S-00 Crisis (The Worthless Album)~~
~~S-01 Crisis (The Valuable Album)~~

At the beginning of creating something, there is a fragile and delicate idea that no one, not even the creator, can say where it'll lead them. So having this moment captured in time and the possibility of returning to it is of great value to the creator.

> "Releasing the demos for *Crisis (The Album)* means providing insight into a stage of the process where I didn't even think if these songs would ever see the light of day. It's the raw first steps that these songs took. First sketches where I felt in small nuances that something was moving. Releasing these demos now is scary. Because they have to prove themselves without the protection of days of further thinking, producing, mixing and mastering that came on top of those sketches. So be kind to them."

— Valentin Hansen

![At Suol Studios in Berlin 2021](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/GW7A96bgkN7hezltUrUrm.png?height=2080&width=3058)

As all Season 02's NFTs are collected, the album will enter its next stage and be shown in its primal and raw state. From then on, it’ll be *Crisis (The Raw Album)* and will be released on DSPs in its draft form.

title: 【林远】vs【裴熙】！
body:
场地外围围过来一圈又一圈的同学，小声的议论着： 
  
 　　“裴熙和林远有仇吗？我记得他俩没什么交集吧？” 
  
 　　“裴熙帮江一宁出头吧？” 
  
 　　“出头？出来装逼还差不多……” 
  
 　　“估计是早上被杨老骂了，憋了一肚子火想找回场子。” 
  
 　　…… 
  
 　　“你要和我打？” 
  
 　　林远的脚步突然停下，回头望向了满脸笑意的裴熙。 
  
 　　裴熙微眯着眼睛，“怎么？不敢？” 
  
 　　两人双目对视，武馆内的气氛突然变得剑拔弩张起来。 
  
 　　林远轻笑一声，“呵。” 
  
 　　“来。” 
  
 　　“喔喔喔喔\~” 
  
 　　听到林远应战，周围立刻响起阵阵起哄的声音。 
  
 　　都属于看热闹不嫌事大。 
  
 　　方子鑫立刻攥着右拳为林远呐喊“助威”道： 
  
 　　“林远！揍他丫的！” 
  
 　　武馆内瞬间变的嘈杂起来，都在讨论着林远裴熙谁胜谁负。 
  
 　　原本想要离开武馆的江一宁和江小鱼，听到林远要和裴熙切磋，也都看向了场地。 
  
 　　三级武者代表的是淬体境，理论上同等基础武道的水平下是远强于二级武者的。 
  
 　　江一宁刚刚输给林远，其实很大程度上输在女性武者的力量劣势上。 
  
 　　刚刚那一脚，如果力量足够，结果可能会有所不同。 
  
 　　只不过也没有人看过裴熙用基础武道和其他人对决，所以无法准确的判断。 
  
 　　“哎，吴敌。”

title: 林守毅
body:
市中心，万世街。 
  
 　　这条街道上聚集着青山市各个世家的商铺。 
  
 　　中心的万世广场集休闲，餐饮，娱乐，零售为一体。 
  
 　　背后的老板是天水国首都“东都”一流世家“王家”，所以万世街在青山市建立之后就迅速成为了城市中心。 
  
 　　因为是早上，所以街上的顾客并不是特别多。 
  
 　　万世街整体面积非常大，在街道的两侧，无数的店铺林立。 
  
 　　“小张炼器”。 
  
 　　“丹颜悦色”。 
  
 　　“剑道教育中心”。 
  
 　　…… 
  
 　　这些店铺的目标顾客都不同，在武风昌盛的天水国完全能够生存的下去。 
  
 　　一名二级的炼器师，其实就能够开一个炼器阁，帮一些平民武者定制武器，维持正常生活了。 
  
 　　林远进入一家名为“宋家炼器阁”的小店铺。 
  
 　　“欢迎光……” 
  
 　　宋义正在小心翼翼的擦拭着挂在四周的冷兵器，听到有顾客进门的声音立刻堆起笑容迎了上去。 
  
 　　林远礼貌的笑道：“宋叔好。” 
  
 　　“林远？” 
  
 　　“你怎么来了？今天没去上课？” 
  
 　　宋义有些惊讶。 
  
 　　他的儿子宋成是林远，方子鑫，吴敌那个七八人小团体里的一员，之前在这边见过几面。 
  
 　　“今天没去，来买点东西。” 
  
 　　宋叔热情道： 
  
 　　“来来来，别站门口，进来说。” 
  
 　　“你要买什么，宋叔帮你挑挑。” 
  
 　　“成本价卖给你。” 
  
 　　宋成一直都和他说，林远他们在学校里非常照顾他，彼此的关系非常好。 
  
 　　“我要买几种灵石。”

title: Immersive Web3 Gaming with Autonomy’s aNFTs
body:
When you think of an NFT, what comes to mind? Static images? Expensive jpegs? Jaded primates?  The truth is, most NFTs in circulation today don’t reflect the dynamism and excitement of the online experiences people are looking for, whether it’s a more intuitive and smooth-functioning DeFi platform or a more immersive gaming experience. Autonomy Network is building tools for bringing the web2 UX to web3; that’s why we developed  autonomous NFTs (aNFTs).

## What is an aNFT?

aNFTs are non-fungible tokens that [can be programmed to create their own transactions,](https://blog.autonomynetwork.io/sentient-nfts-a-new-form-of-life-part-1-the-roadmap-590237e18753) even proactively initiating interactions with other degens and network protocols. In other words, aNFTs can self-execute arbitrary actions under arbitrary conditions – both on-chain and off-chain – depending on how they are programmed.

More specifically, Autonomy Network’s aNFTs can be programmed to:

* Trade/make purchases
* Lend/borrow
* Vote and send messages
* Play with or against you in a game
* Perform off-chain actions based on off-chain events
* Upgrade its own logic
* Evolve and reproduce ([by minting more iterative aNFTs](https://blog.autonomynetwork.io/sentient-nfts-a-new-form-of-life-part-4-evolution-398f97de6753))

aNFTs are capable of automatically executing based on multiple conditions, enabling complex, open-ended interactions depending on the use case at hand. There is no upper bound to the number of conditions and actions aNFTs can be programmed with, and this introduction of custom logic to NFTs has the potential to breathe life into a vast spectrum of on-chain environments.

## How do aNFTs work?

You can automate the execution of either a single action, such as a DeFi swap, or the repeated behavior of an autonomous NPC (aNPC ). And after an aNFT is set up with a single initial transaction, it is essentially self-contained, independent, and does not rely on humans to do anything. Autonomy’s decentralized, incentivised network of bots ensure that requests will always get executed, thereby enabling autonomous smart contract deployments oraNPC state changes around the clock.

Autonomy Network has already rolled out a suite of DeFi tools like [AutoSwap](https://mirror.xyz/0x6B87AbC02Fc4E2406219C69ecE0280ca39476b31/WfPFI1o7eCrkkVej3tSIa6CWva39ciPep8UItVal96s) and [AutoHedge](https://mirror.xyz/0x6B87AbC02Fc4E2406219C69ecE0280ca39476b31/5HfTgun-nWGsYn2Dn8pn86saBfOMR9wUyyKJOu44G-c) which allow users to automate a wide range of on-chain actions. Traders sleep better thanks to limit orders on DEXs and defensive auto-liquidations on DeFi lending protocols executed with these tools. aNFTs are an iteration on this style of automation, one that Autonomy Network  has applied to the world of blockchain-based gaming.

## Battle the First Generation of aNFTs

aNFTs have the potential to reshape the blockchain gaming space by enabling more dynamic human to blockchain interactions and deeper, more immersive storytelling. To show just some of what aNFTs can do, we’re releasing  the first NFT-powered game that inverts the classic player versus environment (PvE) genre and introduces a new concept of[ player versus blockchain](https://mirror.xyz/0x6B87AbC02Fc4E2406219C69ecE0280ca39476b31/flj3TLtY-0mtkuwHj46Cr-7bEf6JuCV85zT-Ok09kSY) (PvB). We’re calling it [ MetaDungeon](http://meta-dungeon.io/). This project is the first time a decentralized automation protocol for NFTs and blockchain games has been deployed, and players will be able to battle and engage with Web3 objects, such as NFTs that are NPCs(non-playable characters).

Each[ on-chain NPC](https://blog.autonomynetwork.io/sentient-nfts-a-new-form-of-life-part-3-npcs-8d18cd8dd955) Boss within MetaDungeon is an aNFT designed to self-transfer in and out of different players’ wallets and drop real loot (in the form of NFTs and other crypto tokens) when defeated.  In this world, heroes can team up to increase their chances of encountering and defeating these Bosses, and split the resulting loot.

MetaDungeon will be launching on August 17, 2022, and players will be able to buy and mint a Hero NFT on August 11. For more details on how to participate in the Hero Genesis Drop and battle the first generation of aNFTs to ever spawn, [join the Autonomy Discord](https://discord.com/invite/2X6fwV54tT).

## aNFTs: More Than Just a Game

To date blockchain games have been dressed up yield farms with shallow mechanics — that’s all about to change. NFTs are meant to be so much more than digital collectibles, and Autonomy Network’s aNFTs are capable of automating a *near-infinite* array of GameFi elements, DeFi protocols, and other decentralized products and services.

We’re excited about MetaDungeon, but this is just a starting point. The real thrill will come from seeing what other game developers and Web3 innovators [create using their own custom aNFTs](https://github.com/Autonomy-Network). After all, aNFTs also have a wide range of practical applications beyond the gaming space, and[ their ability to mutate and self-propagate](https://blog.autonomynetwork.io/sentient-nfts-a-new-form-of-life-part-4-evolution-398f97de6753) based on limitless programmable conditions can enable new DeFi, GameFi, and social interactions in which blockchain protocols evolve over time and engage with you before you even ask.

In short, Metadungeon’s aNFTs demonstrate the open-ended technologies that set aNFTs apart from other non-fungible assets, but it only scratches the surface of what's possible with autonomy.

Learn more about Autonomy’s aNFTs:

* [Part 1: The Roadmap](https://jameskey1.medium.com/sentient-nfts-a-new-form-of-life-part-1-the-roadmap-590237e18753)
* [Part 2: The First Step](https://jameskey1.medium.com/sentient-nfts-a-new-form-of-life-part-2-the-first-step-ee17c7ba6d9c)
* [Part 3: NPCs](https://blog.autonomynetwork.io/sentient-nfts-a-new-form-of-life-part-3-npcs-8d18cd8dd955)
* [Part 4: Evolution](https://blog.autonomynetwork.io/sentient-nfts-a-new-form-of-life-part-4-evolution-398f97de6753)
* [Part 5: Cyber Life](https://blog.autonomynetwork.io/sentient-nfts-a-new-form-of-life-part-5-cyber-life-8db3127dd8aa)
* [Part 6: A Face](https://blog.autonomynetwork.io/sentient-nfts-a-new-form-of-life-part-6-a-face-c60aee5910c)

title: NFT.NYC 2022 Diary by Benyamin Ahmed
body:
**NFT.NYC 2022 Diary by [Benyamin Ahmed](https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni), Work in Fintech Chief Evangelist**

**Day 1: Sunday 19th June, 2022**

The conference doesn't officially start until Tuesday but we decided to come early in order to explore New York. My first time in NYC and the US. When I launched Weird Whales a year ago, I had no idea that my life would take such a turn.

[https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1540670251121070085](https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1540670251121070085)

I was closely watching the market and I knew a sell-out would yield some good pocket money but the additional benefits: huge media [coverage](https://www.cnbc.com/2021/08/25/12-year-old-coder-made-6-figures-selling-weird-whales-nfts.html), collaboration opportunities, speaking engagements and a global network of friends was a pleasant surprise and far more valuable than any ETH that I accumulated.

[New York was the perfect place to stroll](https://www.instagram.com/p/Ce_8_mwJAbJ/) and reflect on what an amazing year it had been.

**Day 2: Monday 20th June, 2022**

I had an early start at 0830, filming with [Dan Sickles](https://twitter.com/dan_sickles). [Dan](https://www.imdb.com/name/nm3974804/) is an award-winning director and was [one of my early supporters](https://www.instagram.com/p/CfB4UDvMy0X/). He is currently working on [I’m New Here](https://www.newhere.xyz/), a feature film about NFTs and crypto art containing a superstar NFT cast including [Claire Silver](https://twitter.com/ClaireSilver12), [Pascal Boyart](https://twitter.com/pascalboyart) and [Justin Aversano](https://twitter.com/justinaversano). I felt privileged to be on the same team, I truly believe that they are part of a movement that will redefine human civilization.

I also bumped into [Scott Sornetta](https://twitter.com/ScottStornetta) on the way out, one of the developers of the first blockchain and mentioned by name in the Bitcoin [whitepaper](https://www.ussc.gov/sites/default/files/pdf/training/annual-national-training-seminar/2018/Emerging_Tech_Bitcoin_Crypto.pdf).

[https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1545789383349092352](https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1545789383349092352)

In the evening we attended the VIP dinner at the Marriott Marquis where the [Work in Fintech](https://www.workinfintech.com) crew met in person for the first time. The VIP dinner was also great opportunity to [make new friends](https://www.instagram.com/p/CfUeWkUrTFK/).

[https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6944978098597593088](https://www.linkedin.com/feed/update/urn:li:activity:6944978098597593088)

I started working closely with Work in Fintech after I first featured on their podcast nearly a year ago.

[https://open.spotify.com/episode/444S2oO6hLdwI4Abxak8bX?si=Og_1bUfVQhq3pkuIhIXOXA](https://open.spotify.com/episode/444S2oO6hLdwI4Abxak8bX?si=Og_1bUfVQhq3pkuIhIXOXA)

**Day 3: Tuesday 21st June, 2022**

Conference kicks off.

Amazing start to the day to see my picture in Times Square.

[https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1541089533156069379](https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1541089533156069379)

We headed off to the iconic [Radio City Music Hall](https://www.rockefellercenter.com/holidays/radio-city-music-hall/) where we listened to the opening speeches and insightful comments from [Ryan Wyatt](https://twitter.com/Fwiz) of Polygon Studios, [Ivan Soto-Wright](https://twitter.com/isotowright) of MoonPay and [David Pakman](https://twitter.com/pakman).

[https://twitter.com/WeirdWhales/status/1539266909178322948](https://twitter.com/WeirdWhales/status/1539266909178322948)

[https://twitter.com/WeirdWhales/status/1539262527443550211](https://twitter.com/WeirdWhales/status/1539262527443550211)

[https://twitter.com/WeirdWhales/status/1539257634825637890](https://twitter.com/WeirdWhales/status/1539257634825637890)

One thing I was constantly on the lookout for was not only content at the talks but also delivery. Watching these industry superstars delivering their talks was a valuable learning experience. The successful speakers delivered using a mix of industry insights, interactivity: getting the crowd to participate seemed key to maintaining attention and interjecting with comedy.

Inspired, I headed off to the [Edison Ballroom](https://edisonballroom.com/) where I was scheduled to deliver my talk.

[https://twitter.com/WorkinFintech/status/1539332058237083653](https://twitter.com/WorkinFintech/status/1539332058237083653)

I’m often asked if I get nervous at these talks. I think I’ve gotten past the nervous phase, I enjoy public speaking and can just zone-out when on stage and focus on my delivery.

[https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1546171056477683713](https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1546171056477683713)

In the evening, I had the opportunity to catch-up with the [NFHeroes](https://www.nfheroes.io/) family.

[https://twitter.com/NFHeroes/status/1539715335342854145?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1539715335342854145%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fmirror.xyz%2Fworkinfintech.eth%2FEE3crMUemQyoC15Px_a_tcEVcUP6RoDC_omwGia3Wcc](https://twitter.com/NFHeroes/status/1539715335342854145?ref_src=twsrc%5Etfw%7Ctwcamp%5Etweetembed%7Ctwterm%5E1539715335342854145%7Ctwgr%5E%7Ctwcon%5Es1_&ref_url=https%3A%2F%2Fmirror.xyz%2Fworkinfintech.eth%2FEE3crMUemQyoC15Px_a_tcEVcUP6RoDC_omwGia3Wcc)

**Day 4: Wednesday 22nd June, 2022**

[Cooltopia](https://www.businesswire.com/news/home/20220609005389/en/Cooltopia-is-Coming-to-NYC-Cool-Cats-Creates-Fully-Immersive-Physical-Version-of-Digital-Game-for-NFT.NYC) day!

Cooltopia was one of the side events I eagerly wanted to attend and it did not disappoint. [Cool Cats](https://www.coolcatsnft.com/) did an amazing job creating a fun, immersive experience. An excellent example of a digital first brand making a presence in the physical world, a concept that all marketeers need to understand, known as ‘phygital’.

[https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1547161072590880768](https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1547161072590880768)

Cooltopia was packed with lots of fun events both physical and mental. It felt like an early iteration of a modern amusement park, I can only imagine how wild this will be in ten to twenty years with the adoption of AR/VR.

[https://twitter.com/WeirdWhales/status/1539954793657126916](https://twitter.com/WeirdWhales/status/1539954793657126916)

The family orientated fun day was also a respite from some of the other events that were geared towards adults only. Unfortunately, I couldn't make it to [ApeFest](https://apefest.com/) or other events hosted at clubs due to US age restrictions.

The lack of children in attendance at NFT.NYC was also worrying. I spoke to at least one family that said price was a concern with tickets costing hundreds of dollars. Perhaps, conferences need to start adjusting pricing for families as I believe many children would benefit hugely from the talks and experience. 

In the evening we had dinner with Cameron Moulene and the [Non-Fungible Films](https://twitter.com/NonFungibleFilm) [Executive Pass](https://opensea.io/collection/nff-studio) holders at [The Grill](https://thegrillnewyork.com), the best restaurant I have ever visited.

![Non Fungible Films teams up with Hollywood](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/BShprsyMsadndEeb3w_a4.png?height=1066&width=1600)

[https://twitter.com/WeirdWhales/status/1539235336848609286](https://twitter.com/WeirdWhales/status/1539235336848609286)

The Non-Fungible Films Executive Pass holders dined at some of the best restaurants, got dropped merch bags with Ledgers and  NFF swag and also got invites to a party at [The Marquee](https://www.instagram.com/marqueeny) with [3LAU](https://twitter.com/3LAU).

[https://twitter.com/cameronmoulene/status/1539489250881716225](https://twitter.com/cameronmoulene/status/1539489250881716225)

**Day 5: Thursday 23rd June, 2022**

Final day of talks.

The SWAG that I distributed starts making its way around the city.

[https://twitter.com/chombo_wombo/status/1540746347200094209](https://twitter.com/chombo_wombo/status/1540746347200094209)

My friend [Shaman](https://twitter.com/shaman4646) from NFHeroes spoke about the inevitable breakthrough of NFTs into Hollywood.

[https://twitter.com/WeirdWhales/status/1539638609640292353](https://twitter.com/WeirdWhales/status/1539638609640292353)

Stopped at the Marriot Marquis and had lunch with Eugene Capon.

[https://twitter.com/CaponDesign/status/1540117040299753472](https://twitter.com/CaponDesign/status/1540117040299753472)

After lunch, I had the pleasure of meeting Brad Levy, CEO at [Symphony](https://symphony.com/). Brad is a futurist and open to exploring all aspects of web3, metaverse and crypto.

[https://twitter.com/WorkinFintech/status/1540040226529329152](https://twitter.com/WorkinFintech/status/1540040226529329152)

I also bumped into William Entriken, lead author of ERC721, we joked that by a stroke of luck, he happened to be in the same place as the youngest ERC721 developer.

[https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1540088861816229890](https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1540088861816229890)

We discussed the Work In Fintech [sponsorship](https://mirror.xyz/workinfintech.eth/XY0v831HiuRuPTO75x4YFp63KRMvtV4B1E-PMKcm1vA) scheme and how it was the world’s first B2B NFT. He was really impressed and supportive.

Before we left for NYC, my dad explained the concept of serendipity and how conferences were a great opportunity to increase your surface area of ‘luck’. Sahil Bloom refers to this as ‘[Engineered Serendipity](https://sahilbloom.substack.com/p/the-most-powerful-ideas)’.

“Some of what we call "luck" is actually the macro result of thousands of micro actions. Your daily habits can put you in a position where "luck" is more likely to strike.

It's possible to increase your serendipity surface area and engineer your own luck.”

This is one of the main benefits of conference attendance in addition to the talks, parties, side events, food and opportunity to explore a new city.

At the closing pool party, I met some more Weird Whales fans.

[https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1540108757543391235](https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1540108757543391235)

To wrap up, it seemed fitting to thank NFT.NYC founder Jodee for organising such a brilliant event.

[https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1540163808559353858](https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1540163808559353858)

**Day 6: Friday 24th June, 2022**

Time to head home.

We had an amazing stay at [The Knickerbocker](https://theknickerbocker.com/) and the trip was a success. New relationships formed and old solidified. There was little talk over the past few days around floor prices, portfolio values and bear markets.

[https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1542113435114246145](https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1542113435114246145)

Everyone that I met was truly into it for the tech and culture, like adventurous travellers that had discovered a new land, we were all excited and desperate to continue exploring.

I felt truly blessed to be working in such an amazing industry at such a critical point in its history.

The bear might have entered but the crypto revolution is far from over. I’m excited by the prospects that it will be something that consumes me for the rest of my life.

[https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1546755497860153344](https://twitter.com/ObiWanBenoni/status/1546755497860153344)

#### Want to learn more about fintech and web3 start-ups?

**Check out the [Work in Fintech website](https://www.workinfintech.com/) and follow us at [LinkedIn](https://www.linkedin.com/company/68856167), [Twitter](https://twitter.com/WorkinFintech), [Discord](https://discord.gg/ng6EwEhtvG), [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCdS4bYoCXaHVgfVm6syUrDw), [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/work_in_fintech/) and [TikTok](https://www.tiktok.com/@workinfintech).**

title: 打一场！
body:
看到吴敌发来的信息，林远的嘴角抽了抽。 
  
 　　回了个滚字之后就将手机丢到了一边。 
  
 　　“这机械系灵种这么强吗？” 
  
 　　林远兴奋的想道。 
  
 　　17岁的二级四脉武者当然不算什么。 
  
 　　不过四十出头的灵力总量能够开四脉，这就侧面说明了灵种的强劲。 
  
 　　境界越高，体内便会有更多的灵力运转，修炼的自然更快。 
  
 　　修炼机械系灵种仅仅几天的时间，林远已经能够清晰的感受到体内灵力的增加，绝对又有了进步。 
  
 　　“一定要考上军校。” 
  
 　　“只有军校才有机械系的导师。” 
  
 　　…… 
  
 　　洗完澡之后的林远终于感觉到了由内而外的疲惫。 
  
 　　这才缓缓闭上眼睛，一根紧绷心弦终于彻底松开，很快进入了梦乡。 
  
 　　机械系灵技的修炼强度极高，需要时刻集中精神。 
  
 　　林远一下午时间的分解修炼，加上晚上的修炼，连续突破，身心俱疲。 
  
 　　导致第二天清晨修炼的时候，吴敌孤独的站着院落之中舒展着筋骨。 
  
 　　有些怀疑人生的自言自语道： 
  
 　　“我是不是还没醒，在做梦？” 
  
 　　啪—— 
  
 　　吴敌扇了自己一巴掌，随后捂住了疼痛的右脸。 
  
 　　林远竟然没有做清晨修炼？！ 
  
 　　三年多的时间，这是第一次。 
  
 　　作为兄弟，吴敌清楚的知道林远有多么自律。 
  
 　　缺席修炼这种事是林远能干的出来的？ 
  
 　　随后吴敌有些担忧的看向了林远的房间： 
  
 　　“妈的，不会死了吧……” 
  
 　　…… 
  
 　　咚咚。 
  
 　　咚咚。 
  
 　　嘎吱——

title: MEGAMIチームに参加しました(I joined MEGAMI team)
body:
こんにちは、じょあんなです。

6月より、MEGAMIチームの末席にPlannerとして加わりました。 ANIFTYで繋がった方々とのご縁でお誘いいただいた次第です。

![この一言だけですごく嬉しかったです](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/OZzikTFjLu-JMQCol7k6l.png?height=277&width=1313)

主に公式DiscordやTwitterで告知をしたり、いろんなイベントやスペースなどに出没してはMEGAMIの価値観や考えを広めていきたいと思います。

## My New PFP

![New pfp](https://images.mirror-media.xyz/publication-images/OIDmeXkeu1OH9XF7EPB0r.png?height=4000&width=3833)

これは私がMEGAMIチームで使っているアイコンです。チームメンバーはジェネラティブの試作品の中から1枚好きな画像を選んでプロフィールに使うことができます。こちらはNFT化されることはないのですが、私にとっては特別な一枚です。

MEGAMIはプレセールを目前にして、Twitterで #myMegami イベントを開きました。皆さんがどのMEGAMIを選ぶのか、なぜ選ぶのかを発信してもらうイベントでしたが、私がこの一枚を選んだのにも理由があります。

これまで「ANIFTYちゃん」の画像を長らくDiscordのアイコンにしていたので、まず茶髪で三つ編みの子が今までの印象とマッチしているかなと思いました。また、Megamiたちが左手に持っているパーツはpower sourceと呼ばれているのですが、私にとって「力の源」はまさしく愛＝ハートです。クリエイターを愛し、居場所を作る「女神」として皆さんの前に再び現れたいという思いでこの一枚を選びました。

## チームについて

MEGAMIチームに入ってまず驚いたのが、アニメNFT界隈では有名なコレクターさんたちが実は優秀なエンジニアだったり、多くのプロジェクトにアドバイザーとして呼ばれていたり、自身でNFTコレクションを販売されていたりと皆さんが各方面で才能にあふれた方たちだということです。

また、クレームや批判、質問などにも一人が矢面に立つことなく、団結して対応できるところも素晴らしいと思います。プロジェクトとしても多くのアニメNFTプロジェクトやコミュニティとパートナーシップを結び、親交を深めたり、誰かがピンチに陥ったときは「姉妹」として手を差し伸べる、その姿勢から大いに学ぶものがあります。

## さいごに

MEGAMIのプレセールが7月16日　午前10時（日本時間）に始まります。 
 ミントリストを持っている方は保有しているミントリストの数だけMegamiを購入できるのですが、お気に入りでどうしても取られたくない子がいる人はオークションで高めの値段でミントを、それ以外の皆さんは開始24時間後に最低価格の0.08ETHでミントできます。 
 一緒に楽しみましょう！！

[https://mint.megami.io/](https://mint.megami.io/)

title: Fluence: The Ultimate Web3 Computing Infrastructure
body:
**Fluence is a peer-to-peer platform, ready to revolutionize the way blockchain evolves. In this article, let’s find out what is Fluence, and its potential & growth aspects.**

### TLDR

* What is Fluence?
* Features of Fluence Network
* Aqua and Consensus
* Peer-To-Peer Digital Economy
* Use Cases

Fluence is a community-driven, open-source, permissionless, and decentralized blockchain ecosystem. Fluence aims to help developers to host peer-to-peer applications in a trustless manner. 

You might be wondering, several web2 platforms provide for application development, then why Fluence? Let me explain it in simple terms. 

Developers want their apps to be as secure and smooth as possible. At the same time, users also want their data to be as safe and private as possible. But the existing web2 infrastructures are vulnerable to hacks. We all have heard how hackers stole user [data from McDonalds](https://www.wsj.com/articles/mcdonalds-hit-by-data-breach-in-south-korea-taiwan-11623412800) in Korea and Taiwan. Fluence could be the go-to web3 solution for data privacy and safety. But how?

Fluence hosts apps that run independently of centralized institutions and cloud providers. Google Cloud and Amazon Web Services influence how the data is transferred and accessed around the globe. There is nothing wrong with that, yet having a robust web3 alternative can’t hurt, right! 

However, in a peer-to-peer world, data security is often overlooked. But not for long. Fluence offers an integrated solution that can ensure app data never ends up in the wrong hands.

Is that all? No! Fluence has a ton of unique features in its sleeves. Fluence innovates the next generation of internet computing that is permissionless, scalable, and composable. Let’s take one bite at a time to understand these concepts. 

Permissionless means a user does not require permission to interact with the network. It’s like an open supermarket, without any cashiers! But on the blockchain, no single user can misbehave and try and do fraudulent transactions. Permissionless also implies anyone can deploy applications using the extensive database of Fluence.

But what if you are a high-end developer of apps with millions of users? Or whether you are a small-scale developer with a few thousand users? Don’t worry, Fluence has got you covered. Fluence offers high scalability so that each application can host billions of users. The most interesting fact here is the ability of these applications to create subnets on the Fluence network. These subnets act as arms of Fluence without affecting speed and reliability. In technical terms, it is known as sharding.

![Features](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*jnz7HyDfEYto83ALAlJsOQ.png)

### Prominent Features of Fluence

Okay, now your apps are working smoothly, but being a vigilant developer, you are concerned about whether there is a verification mechanism. 

Most other blockchain projects would explain how the technology is secure etc. But Fluence aims to be inclusive of both web3 and web2 people. That’s why Fluence provides you with the choice of selecting a specific validator whom you can trust. Let me put this straight. If someone wants to verify their own application data, they can become a validator on Fluence. Yes, you, as a developer, get to enjoy complete autonomy.

Above all, Fluence provides a flexible consensus mechanism. Explaining the consensus mechanism is beyond the scope of this article. But Fluence assures the trustless consensus is as good as you think. It enables applications to opt for consensus for specific tasks. In a nutshell, Fluence supports various consensus mechanisms as Aqua libraries.

### What is Aqua? 

Aqua is an open-source programming language fuelling fluence. Yes, it’s the heart and soul of Fluence that helps to implement better coordination in consensus. Aqua is worthwhile in implementing trusted consensus algorithms like Raft and trustless ones like Tendermint. That’s not it. Aqua allows for creating and sustaining peer-to-peer environments. It is much required, as peer-to-peer(p2p) transactions must be kept separate from p2p computations. Also, it forms the basis of an open, decentralized application marketplace. Aqua is also Turing-complete, based on process calculus, and allows to implementation of custom algorithms for any network topology.

### Relevance of Fluence Network in the Modern Era

The Internet envisions to bring equality to all. Yet, a generic digital divide exists, and multinational conglomerates own users’ data. These companies sell user data to others, making more profit. Take the example of google and amazon. They dominate the current data infrastructure niche. Eventually, it leads to data totalitarianism. The concentration of private data in a non-private environment is a threat to data management in general. How? Imagine a day when Google or Amazon fails. In a world that considers data the new gold, a system with a single point of failure is a significant risk.

The present world is fast becoming digital-oriented. More people use the internet daily, creating a large amount of data. This phenomenon is like to increase in the future. At a point, the existing system will fail terribly, leaving user data vulnerable. This tipping point is not exactly far away. Hence decentralization is the best practical solution and way forward. This is the opportunity for the peer-to-peer market model to dethrone business-business or business-client models. Logically speaking, Fluence has a better chance to lead this wave of decentralization. It provides flexibility, accessibility, and usability in addition to security to applications.

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*OM0lyG0NWfEt8j-3MJInJw.png)

Adobe’s Digital Economy Index underlines this. In the last seven years, the digital purchasing power of the United States has increased by 23%. More people are choosing to live online. It further accelerates the need for decentralized data management efforts. P2P allows applications to connect with users and keep sensitive, private data under their control. Essentially, users own their data in a true sense. Fluence can facilitate this upcoming P2P revolution with the right tools.

### Some Use Cases

![](https://miro.medium.com/max/1400/1\*WYCPDFFSZKIlT9fZ7pFu-Q.png)

As Fluence is a cloud computer, it has good deal of applications, from messaging to the internet of things. It can host web apps and other communication platforms.

Fluence can build censorship-resistant applications that can run on users’ devices. These apps can be social networks or streaming protocols. In an ever-growing creator economy, Fluence can become the beacon of hope for those from countries with high censorship norms. Fluence also removes the necessity of a central authority to manage the applications. It helps DAOs to establish and run sustainably. If DAOs are healthy, communities will become the finest force displaying the essence of decentralization.

### Comparison of Aqua and Traditional Languages

First and foremost, programs written on Aqua are not executed fully at deployed devices. Firstly, the code is processed into particles. Then, particles travel over the network to trigger functions on remote peers. Sounds complicated? Not really. Consider particles as a bag of candies and each peer as a kid. Now you take the candy bag and go to each kid. The kid will demand a specific candy, and you can comfortably deliver the candy from the candy bag. Each peer has a different set of requests and requirements. The program chooses the function and activates the request. Simple, right?

Let’s also go through the WebAssembly runtime in Fluence, called Marine. Marine executes computations triggered by Aqua programs. Marine also provides a secure code sandbox. It ensures that hosted code can only access the system with explicit permission. These services are very lightweight and fast, and effectively, it performs as a distributed serverless engine. Marine and Aqua together standardize open source components for data processing.

Well, it's a wrap. To know more about Fluence, visit its website <https://fluence.network/>.

title: 能用钱解决的事，那都不是事！
body:
万世街，上仙汇。 
  
 　　就算是在无数高级餐厅云集的万世街，上仙汇也能够位列前三。 
  
 　　简单的一餐至少就是十万天水币，如果是宴请，那就是百万天水币以上。 
  
 　　昂贵的原因除了名气和环境之外，就是食材。 
  
 　　“来，林远，吴敌，尝尝这银鳍鳕鱼。” 
  
 　　热腾腾的一小碗银鳍鳕鱼汤端到了上来，吴大富招呼道。 
  
 　　鱼香淡淡飘出，林远就闻了那么一下，就感觉到腹中打鼓。 
  
 　　银鳍鳕鱼，这是海中的二级灵兽，肉质鲜美，这一小碗就要88888天水币，餐桌上这四碗下来就是三十多万。 
  
 　　“这一口就是三万块啊。” 
  
 　　林远小心肝都在颤抖，从来没这么奢侈过。 
  
 　　当银鳍鳕鱼滑入林远口腔之时，林远除了感受到一股极致的鲜美以外，还有一股淡淡的灵力仿佛融入了林远的体内。 
  
 　　看到吴敌和林远享受的神情，吴大富笑道： 
  
 　　“味道还行吧。” 
  
 　　“可惜金鳍鳕鱼以我的身份没办法订到，以后就看能不能沾沾你们两个小子的光了。” 
  
 　　金鳍鳕鱼，这是海中的三级灵兽，极其稀少。 
  
 　　一般来说都是提供给那些世家或者是武道强者，他们这种房地产界的商人是很难吃到的。 
  
 　　坐在吴大富身旁的女人，是吴敌的母亲江秀，气质温婉。 
  
 　　吴敌立马拍胸脯道： 
  
 　　“老爸你放心。” 
  
 　　“有我这个天才武者。” 
  
 　　“以后让你餐餐金鳍鳕鱼，吃到吐为止！” 
  
 　　江秀和吴大富的笑容满面。 
  
 　　得知吴敌在高考之前成为三级武者的时候，他们欣喜的同时也长舒一口气。 
  
 　　总算是将吴敌养大成人了。 
  
 　　不仅仅没成纨绔，反倒成为了天才武者。 
  
 　　吴大富轻拍着林远的肩膀，对吴敌笑道： 
  
 　　“吴敌啊。” 
  
 　　“你能突破到三级武者，怎么着也得谢谢林远吧？” 
  
 　　林远听到这话，连忙摆手道： 
  
 　　“吴叔，别别别别。” 
  
 　　“我也没办法替他修炼，都是他自己一点一滴修炼得来的。” 
  
 　　吴敌连忙放下筷子，起身兴奋道： 
  
 　　“老爸你听到没？” 
  
 　　“我就说我一向很努力，你偏不信！” 
  
 　　一旁的江秀听到吴敌还在自吹自擂，连忙把吴敌拽了下来： 
  
 　　“行了行了，别吹了。” 
  
 　　“你就是个磨子，推一下转一下，不推就不转。” 
  
 　　作为父母，吴大富和江秀实在是太了解自己这个儿子了。 
  
 　　直到遇到林远之后，吴敌的性格才慢慢转变了一些。 
  
 　　从小就成熟的林远确实影响了吴敌很多，甚至一度令吴敌有些崇拜。 
  
 　　……
